job_description:
Site web billingue et description du poste en français à venir. Les soumissions en français sont les bienvenues.

This is the job for you if you are fast on your feet, an independent and self-motivated learner, and extremely excited about building things from scratch – but building them to last and grow! We want to hear from you if you love making products that make sense – that means you’re not shy to ask lots of questions, and definitely not scared to say “wait a minute, do we really need to write code for this?”

You’ll be working on a small team and you may be on your own sometimes, but it’s important that you be an empathetic team player who likes to talk through problems with others and share your knowledge.

When we say full-stack, we know it’s a complicated term. It’s okay if your experience is skewed towards one part of the stack! The key thing we are looking for is a good baseline level of familiarity with different parts of the stack and a willingness to move around and out of your comfort zone.

About Rogo

Rogo is focused on building the world's first Natural Language Interface for data analysis. Robust natural language understanding and semantic parsing sits at the core of our efforts to create the future of analytic tooling. We're transforming academic and lab AI experiments into enterprise-ready products.

This is an opportunity to work on the full lifecycle of an AI solution and build a solid, scalable product that users love. Rogo is looking for engineers who can take problems into their own hands, and prototype, iterate, and ship quickly.

You'd be perfect for this role if you're a product engineer who loves data and cares deeply about making it accessible.

Some Things You Might Do In This Role

Help build and architect a robust product and API for doing data exploration in plain English.
Develop analytic data products across econometric, statistic, and machine learning domains
Create beautiful and dynamic front-end visualizations for exploring data.
Contribute to the design and creation of a robust ensemble algorithm for translating normal English questions into executable commands (semantic parsing).
Create, deploy, and maintain ETL pipelines and ensure data quality.
Create experiences, digestible analytic outputs, and automated reasoning capabilities that will continually delight our users.

About You

We want you to apply if you:

Have 4+ years of experience writing and shipping code professionally;
Write clean, legible, and testable code;
Are comfortable working across the stack, from frontend technologies like React all the way through to cloud providers;
Have solid experience with at least one server-side web stack – Python experience is ideal, but we're flexible;
Know your way around database systems, whether SQL, NoSQL, and can talk about how to pick one over the other;
Are able to articulate tradeoffs in technology choices and relate them to business needs;
Have excellent communication skills and can explain complex technical problems in an accessible and compassionate way;
Care a whole lot about building good user experiences;
Have a proven track record of mentorship (if you’re a more senior developer).

Some Extra Stuff We Love

Experience working on early-stage startups and ability to talk to us about growing pains resulting from early technical decisions.
An eye for user experience in data visualization
A strong interest in DevOps methodologies, operational tooling, observability and automation. We are building foundations, and we want to make them solid.
Experience building enterprise SaaS products, especially in the financial sector.
Exposure to products using machine learning

We are a remote-first company and Montreal region is preferred, but we are open to candidates anywhere in the EST time zone in Canada. Our ideal start date is ASAP.
